metadata.title: CVE-2021-23984 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A malicious extension could have opened a popup window lacking an addressbar. The title of the popup lacking an address bar should not be fullycontrollable, but in this situation was. This could have been used to spoofa website and attempt to trick the user into providing credentials. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
